entry.title: Pashinyan reminds Putin of the Russian peacekeeping responsibility in the Lachin corridor

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan reminds Putin of the Russian peacekeeping responsibility in the Lachin corridor
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe blockade of Artsakh by Azerbaijan has entered its 16th day exacerbating the humanitarian situation of the 120 000 people who remain besieged in their homeland. üìçArmenia's security council chief decries Russia as Prime Minister attends a Russia-led summit in St. Petersburg. üìçPutin holds a tripartite meeting with Armenia‚Äôs and Azerbaijan‚Äôs leaders in CIS informal summit in St. Petersburg. üìçFormer Karabakh Army commander Samvel Babayan warns of a new regional war. üìçFollowing a Court ruling, Armenia‚Äôs government provided CivilNet with the donation contract of its shares of Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Combine.

entry.title: Large rally in Karabakh capital draws tens of thousands

media:group.media:title: Large rally in Karabakh capital draws tens of thousands
media:group.media:description:
Tens of thousands of people in Artsakh marched to Stepanakert's central square on Sunday in a rally demanding the opening of the Lachin Corridor. The corridor, which is the only route connecting Artsakh with Armenia and the outside world, has been blocked since December 12. Azerbaijani government workers and civilians, dubbing themselves as environmental activists, have been blocking the road, leaving more than hundred thousand people in a blockade.
